com.aeonium.javafx.utils

Class LabelService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aeonium.javafx.utils.LabelService

  • public class LabelService
extends java.lang.Object
    The label service provides a lookup map for labels placed in several scenes that are assigned to controls via labelFor attribute. The label service is also used by the validator service.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Robert Rohm <r.rohm@aeonium-systems.de>

      private static void findLabels(javafx.scene.Scene scene, javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.scene.Node> children, java.util.List<javafx.scene.Node> list)
      A variant of findLabels that tracks the scene in the parameter list - normally each node in the scene should know it's scene, but ist seems like node in a TitledPane does not.
      static javafx.scene.control.Label getLabelFor(javafx.scene.Node node)
      Deprecated. 
      Use getLabelsFor() for retrieving all Labels that may reference the node.
      static java.util.List<javafx.scene.control.Label> getLabelsFor(javafx.scene.Node node)
      Get all labels that reference the given node.
      private static javafx.scene.Scene getSceneOf(javafx.scene.control.Label label) 
      static void initialize(javafx.scene.Parent root)
      Initialize all labels that are registered as label for a node.
      static void initialize(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Initialize the labels in the given scene, i.e.,: find all labels in the scene, loop over the list of found labels and check for a 'Label for'-reference, and, if found, put it in the internal map, set cursor style and add a click handler that lets the user focus the node by clicking it's label.

      • getLabelFor

        public static javafx.scene.control.Label getLabelFor(javafx.scene.Node node)
        Deprecated. Use getLabelsFor() for retrieving all Labels that may reference the node.
        Find the first label that is a label for this control.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to search the label for.
        Returns:
        The first Label mapped to the node, or null

      • getLabelsFor

        public static java.util.List<javafx.scene.control.Label> getLabelsFor(javafx.scene.Node node)
        Get all labels that reference the given node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to search labels for.
        Returns:
        A list of labels that reference the node.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
        Initialize the labels in the given scene, i.e.,:
        • find all labels in the scene,
        • loop over the list of found labels and check for a 'Label for'-reference,
        • and, if found, put it in the internal map, set cursor style and add a click handler that lets the user focus the node by clicking it's label.
        Parameters:
        scene - The scene to scan

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(javafx.scene.Parent root)
        Initialize all labels that are registered as label for a node.
        Parameters:
        root - The root node to scan from
        Since:
        1.1 Bind label's disable property to disabled property of node.
        See Also:
        initialize(Scene scene)

      • findLabels

        private static void findLabels(javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.scene.Node> children,
                               java.util.List<javafx.scene.Node> list)
        Iterate through the children and their children, and collect all label nodes in the internal labels map. The method checks whether a label is already an element of the list and inserts the label only once. Hence, the method can be executed several times on the same scene/node.

        Special treatment is required in this method for TabPane, since the Tab instances are not elements or the children collection.

        Parameters:
        children - List of child nodes
        list - .

      • findLabels

        private static void findLabels(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                               javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.scene.Node> children,
                               java.util.List<javafx.scene.Node> list)
        A variant of findLabels that tracks the scene in the parameter list - normally each node in the scene should know it's scene, but ist seems like node in a TitledPane does not.
        Parameters:
        scene - The current scene
        children - Observable list of child nodes
        list - .
